finding: The SNP rs8042149 was identified in the first GWAS analyses of PTSD, which highlighted significant genetic risk factors associated with the disorder. This finding was part of a broader effort to understand the genetic underpinnings of PTSD, linking it to shared genetic risk with other conditions such as cardiovascular disease (CVD). The findings from the PTSD GWAS were utilized to develop polygenic risk scores for predicting PTSD risk in veteran cohorts.
title: Leveraging large-scale genetics of PTSD and cardiovascular disease demonstrates robust shared risk and improves risk prediction accuracy

finding: The intronic variant rs7183859 in THSD4 was previously implicated in lung function, showing larger effect size estimates in non-EUR and particularly African ancestries with significant ancestry-correlated heterogeneity.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The rs4702 SNP, identified as a noncoding transcript variant located in the gene FURIN, was associated with opioid use disorder (OUD) and overlapped with genomic risk loci for the Externalizing model, suggesting its relevance in substance use disorders and related behavioral traits.
title: Advancing Gene Discovery for Substance Use Disorders Using Additional Traits Related to Behavioral Disinhibition

finding: The SNP rs11071559, located in the RORA gene, exhibited significant associations in the liability GWAS for asthma while remaining undetected in the binary analysis. This included corroborating evidence from earlier research on asthma genetics.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs147002962 was found intronic to C15orf41, and together with rs141228575, it reported a meta-analysis P-value of 3.03x10-4, supporting its connection to AD.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals new Alzheimer’s disease-associated rare variants in loci related to synaptic function and neuronal development

finding: Similar to rs147002962, rs141228575 was intronic to C15orf41 with the same significant association with AD reported in the study.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals new Alzheimer’s disease-associated rare variants in loci related to synaptic function and neuronal development

finding: This SNP was part of the Hyper Insulin cluster located near IGF1R. It had a P value of 3.4 x 10^-9 in a multi-ancestry cohort, significantly better than its P of 2.4 x 10^-4 in a European cohort. The variant was linked to higher circulating IGF-1 levels, indicating a potential role in insulin resistance.
title: Multi-ancestry Polygenic Mechanisms of Type 2 Diabetes Elucidate Disease Processes and Clinical Heterogeneity

finding: In the study, rs4887091 was identified as a variant within the CAD GWAS locus that modulated the function of a super chromatin interactome through a change in a CTCF binding site. This finding emphasized the potential role of this variant in orchestrating large-scale chromatin changes associated with coronary artery disease (CAD).
title: Single cell variant to enhancer to gene map for coronary artery disease

finding: The variant rs7182567 was reported as an SMC-specific caQTL and also classified as a CAD GWAS variant with a p-value of 5.4×10^-26. It was shown to act as a bulk GTEx eQTL for ADAMTS7 in tibial artery, indicating its significance in CAD-related genetic risk through its effect on gene expression.
title: Single cell variant to enhancer to gene map for coronary artery disease

finding: SNP rs12916774 demonstrated a significant relationship with femur neck and total BMD, contributing to our understanding of genetic factors influencing BMD.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: Female-specific SNP rs45446698 (locating near CYP3A7) indicated significant differences in effect sizes between genders, leading to insights on sex-specific BMD regulation.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The variant rs2036527 was previously associated with cigarettes per day, demonstrating its relevance in smoking behaviour among the 32,389 African American individuals studied.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: Variant rs9646181 was previously described as being associated with smoking trajectory contrast I, showing its involvement in differing smoking behaviour patterns.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The variant rs11634974 showed significant associations with six traits in European individuals, including 'Current tobacco smoking,' consistent with findings from this study.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: Variant rs11636198 was associated with 'Current tobacco smoking' among other traits in European populations, confirming its importance in smoking behaviours.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The variant rs12905212 was significantly linked to the same traits, including 'Current tobacco smoking,' supporting its impact on smoking behaviour in the studied cohort.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The minor T-allele at rs2472297 was negatively associated with cereal intake (beta=-0.059) and positively associated with coffee intake (beta=0.142). This SNP was related to higher BMI and cholesterol levels, with mediational pathways identified involving increased coffee and decreased cereal intake, highlighting its impact on cognitive health and metabolism.
title: Increased brain volume from higher cereal and lower coffee intake: Shared genetic determinants and impacts on cognition and metabolism

finding: This missense variant, strongly linked to tobacco use (p=2.79e-175), highlighted the genetic underpinnings of nicotine dependency.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs17565841, associated with the OCA2 gene, was identified as a top association with 'slow' PD progression. The non-reference allele also contributed to an increased probability of slower progression.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The rs117618017 variant near the APH1B gene was significantly associated with longevity as found in the parental-longevity GWAS.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: The SNP rs11070995 was linked to the prognostic role of androgen receptor (AR) in triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC). It was noted that a significant percentage of patients showed positive AR expression, which negatively influenced disease-free survival. The findings emphasized the importance of this SNP in understanding the ethnic variation in TNBC presentation and potential targeted therapy implications.
title: Molecular Profiling of a Triple-negative Breast Cancer Cohort in India for EGFR and AR expression analyzed for patient outcomes showed a distinct subset of cellular co-expression

finding: The rs877087 T allele in the RYR3 gene was associated with an increased risk of heart failure (HF), with a hazard ratio of 1.13 (95% CI 1.02 to 1.25, p=0.02) found in patients prescribed dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers (dCCB). In patients with a previous history of heart disease, TT homozygotes had a higher risk of new coronary heart disease (CHD) or HF compared to CC variant carriers (HR 1.25, 95% CI 1.09 to 1.44, p=0.002). The study suggested that switching T allele carriers to alternative treatments could potentially reduce HF incidence by 9.2%.
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: The rs1807214 variant was significant for CAD and prioritized MFGE8 as a causal gene, suggesting vascular smooth muscle cell involvement.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The rs588136 variant was linked to higher HDL-cholesterol levels but intriguingly associated with increased CAD risk, reflecting complex lipid interactions.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: HMG20A SNP (rs1005752) showed association with late T2D diagnosis, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors that influence T2D in older patients.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs2472297, located within the CYP1A2 gene, was positively associated with fasting plasma caffeine levels. This association highlighted the SNP's role in caffeine metabolism, which may influence the physiological response to caffeine, impacting body mass index (BMI) in the context of drug-target Mendelian randomization.
title: Comparison of caffeine consumption behavior with plasma caffeine levels as exposures in drug-target Mendelian randomization and implications for interpreting effects on obesity

finding: This FURIN gene variant was identified as genome-wide significant (p=8.82x10^-7) for OA, with additional supportive variants present in strong linkage disequilibrium.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study of opioid addiction: OPRM1 and Beyond

finding: Variant rs1426654 in SLC24A5 showed significant associations with skin pigmentation traits, evidencing important genetic variability across different ancestries.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: CYP19A1:rs10046 was notably linked to reading and language disorders, replicated in both GRaD and ALSPAC, emphasizing its relevance to reading performance.
title: Genetic and Demographic Predictors of Latent Reading Ability in Two Cohorts

finding: Associated with DNAAF4, this SNP displayed positive correlations in both GRaD and ALSPAC cohorts, indicating its potential impact on reading ability.
title: Genetic and Demographic Predictors of Latent Reading Ability in Two Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs7183733 was linked to dentures as revealed by MR analysis, indicating that genetically predicted CA12 levels may affect the development or prevalence of dentures (OR=1.12, 95% CI 1.08-1.16, p-value=5.59e-12). This association was determined to be a case of vertical pleiotropy, where the relationship between CA12 and dentures was maintained without reverse causation (p-value=1.83e-04, MR-Steiger test). This suggested that rs7183733 played a role in the genetic factors influencing CA12 and subsequently, the prevalence of dentures.
title: Identification of therapeutic targets for 16 clinical diseases by integrating human plasma proteome with genome

finding: The T allele of RYR3 rs877087 was associated with an increased risk of heart failure in patients treated with dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers, evidenced by a hazard ratio of 1.13 (95% CI 1.02-1.25). The risk was notably amplified in participants with high polygenic scores for body fat mass, lean mass, and lipoprotein A, reaching a relative risk of 4.4 in females aged 65-70 years compared to those without T alleles.
title: Combining pharmacogenetics and patient characteristic polygenic scores to improve outcome prediction for Calcium Channel Blocker treatment

finding: The SNP rs139271800, located in gene PLIN1, was identified through a genome-wide analysis of rare non-synonymous variants as being associated with waist-to-hip ratio adjusted for BMI (WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub>), indicating a role in fat distribution.
title: Identification of rare loss of function variation regulating body fat distribution

finding: The variant rs750619494 in PLIN1 was linked to lower WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub> through the mechanism of loss-of-function, substantiating its role in the regulation of body fat distribution.
title: Identification of rare loss of function variation regulating body fat distribution

finding: The rs16969968 genotype from the CHRNA5 gene was found to be associated with age at first birth in never smokers, indicating potential pleiotropic effects. In the context of this study, the genetic liability for smoking initiation linked to this SNP was strongly associated with a younger age of first birth in both women (mean difference of -2.647 years, 95% CI: -3.565, -1.730) and men (mean difference of -2.824 years, 95% CI: -4.072, -1.575). This finding suggested that individuals with this genetic variant tended to have children at a younger age.
title: Health behaviours prior to pregnancy and fertility outcomes: Triangulation of evidence in the Norwegian Mother, Father and Child Cohort Study (MoBa)

finding: This SNP, part of the CYP1A1-CYP1A2 locus, has a historical association with coffee intake reported in the literature, linking it to caffeine metabolism.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: This SNP (LOC101929457-LINGO1) was newly identified, suggesting a novel contribution to the genetic understanding of coffee habits.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: This missense variant indicated a deleterious impact while being linked to increased coffee consumption, suggesting a complex relationship with metabolic health.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs111395362 reached genome-wide significance in the RBS-R ritualistic GWAS (p = 7.7 × 10−9), although it did not map within 100 kb of any gene. It was found to be approximately 500 kb downstream of SPATA8, a gene previously associated with conduct disorders in an ADHD cohort.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The SNP rs75957257 reached genome-wide significance in the RBS-R injurious GWAS (p = 2.3 × 10−8). Similar to rs111395362, it did not map within 100 kb of any gene but was approximately 200 kb upstream of SPATA8.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The SNP rs58349661 was identified within the FMN1/GREM1 gene region as a new locus that interacts with Body Mass Index (BMI) in the context of colorectal cancer risk. This finding underscored the relevance of genetic variants in understanding how environmental factors, such as obesity, can modify cancer risk.
title: Adiposity and cancer: meta-analysis, mechanisms, and future perspectives

finding: The minor T-allele of SNP rs1079396 was associated with shaping DNA methylation levels at the SGK269 gene specifically in SS patients. This observation pointed to its potential role in influencing disease phenotype.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The minor G-allele of SNP rs7169481 resulted in increased DNA methylation at the ATP10A gene specifically among SS patients. This indicates a potential protective role of this variant.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: SNP rs1261660572 demonstrated a p-value of 5.62×10−7, with a minor allele (CACAA) frequency of 0.03425 in cases versus 0.25 in controls, leading to an odds ratio of 0.1064. This variant is situated upstream of the ALDH1A2 gene, which participates in retinoic acid biosynthesis.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: The rs35647788 variant, found in an intron of the PCSK6 gene, showed a strong association with TFS across both stages of the study and achieved genome-wide significance with a hazard ratio (HR) of 4.11 in meta-analysis. This variant correlated with poorer survival outcomes, and PCSK6 protein was noted for high expression in lung tissue.
title: PCSK6 and Survival in Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis

finding: The synonymous variant rs8040868 in the CHRNA5/A3/B4 gene cluster was linked to 0.25 attributable DALYs through multiple smoking-related conditions, including lung cancer and COPD.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The in-frame insertion rs191156695 in MFGE8 was associated with preventing 39.1 yearly population DALYs through reduced ischemic heart disease risk, demonstrating a protective effect.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: This SNP accounted for a significant proportion (54%) of the variance in DBP levels in out-of-sample predictions, reinforcing its effect on DBP.
title: Genetic correlates of vitamin D-binding protein and 25 hydroxyvitamin D in neonatal dried blood spots

finding: The SNP rs8042059 was found to be MPRA-positive and also identified as an eQTL for the CHRNA5 gene. The reference allele A of this SNP associated with increased expression in comparison to the alternative allele C, both in MPRA results and eQTL analyses, indicating a direct regulatory role in schizophrenia.
title: Systematic investigation of allelic regulatory activity of schizophrenia-associated common variants

finding: The SNP rs11418931 exhibited significant MPRA allelic activity but was not detected in eQTL analyses. This variant is significant for the schizophrenia-associated gene region and contributed to the understanding of the regulatory landscape at its locus.
title: Systematic investigation of allelic regulatory activity of schizophrenia-associated common variants

finding: The SNP rs12913832, located near the HERC2 gene, was replicated as a locus associated with retinal Df. This SNP has previously been associated with pigmentation and several ocular conditions, reinforcing its role in retinal vascular complexity.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian randomization study implicates inflammaging biomarkers in retinal vasculature, cardiometabolic diseases and longevity

finding: The SNP rs35717941, near the OCA2 gene, was confirmed as significantly associated with retinal Df. This locus has been linked to pigmentation and other visual conditions, supporting its relevance to vascular health in the eye.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian randomization study implicates inflammaging biomarkers in retinal vasculature, cardiometabolic diseases and longevity

finding: The SNP rs11259953 was highlighted as one of the top exonic SNPs linked to the WHAMM gene.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: The SNP rs11259954, also exonic and in WHAMM, was associated significantly but with speculated relevance.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: The SNP rs4702 was validated experimentally as a causal variant for the expression of the gene FURIN, which contributes to the risk of multiple complex behavioral and psychiatric traits. It had been previously implicated in schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
title: Trans-ethnic eQTL meta-analysis of human brain reveals regulatory architecture and candidate causal variants for brain-related traits

finding: The SNP rs117618017 was a candidate causal variant associated with Alzheimer’s disease (AD) through increasing gene expression of APH1B, a subunit of the gamma-secretase complex. Despite negative experimental results regarding its direct effect on protein sequence, the analysis suggested an alternative mechanism by which this variant raised AD risk.
title: Trans-ethnic eQTL meta-analysis of human brain reveals regulatory architecture and candidate causal variants for brain-related traits

finding: The variant rs146381257 in the ZNF106 gene was positively associated with any 2+ primary cancers and had an odds ratio of 7.82. Its risk allele was found in higher frequencies among individuals with prostate, lung, breast, urinary bladder, pancreatic, and kidney cancers.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The analysis indicated that the allele T of rs2606345 was identified as a risk marker for CAP with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.49 (95% CI: 1.29-1.69, p=0.0001). This SNP had a notable correlation with increased susceptibility to pneumonia and showed variations in allele frequency across populations, being the major allele in Europeans (66.6%) compared to Africans (5%) and Asians (5-30%). Furthermore, it was positively correlated with higher COVID-19 mortality rates, suggesting a potential link between this SNP and severe infectious disease outcomes.
title: Human genetic factors associated with pneumonia susceptibility, a cue for COVID-19 mortality

finding: The SNP rs4646903 was noted as a protective marker against CAP with an odds ratio of 0.79 (95% CI: 0.62-0.96, p=0.03). This finding contrasted with other SNPs in the same analysis, suggesting that the presence of the C allele provides some level of genetic resistance to pneumonia, hence showing its protective role in the context of CAP.
title: Human genetic factors associated with pneumonia susceptibility, a cue for COVID-19 mortality

finding: For rs1048943, it was recorded as another risk marker for CAP, with an odds ratio of 1.31 (95% CI: 0.90-1.71, p=0.002). This SNP was associated with increased incidence of pneumonia, further emphasizing the role of genetically determined alterations in CYP1A1 activity in pneumonia pathogenesis.
title: Human genetic factors associated with pneumonia susceptibility, a cue for COVID-19 mortality

finding: The rs7173743 SNP, located in the intron of the MORF4L1 gene, was replicated in the context of HF with a nominal significance of P=2.36×10^-4.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The rs121913502 SNP in IDH2 was linked to reduced lifespan with a p-value of 1.0 × 10^-20, indicating its critical role in lifespan studies.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: This SNP was associated with tobacco use disorder (TUD), where genetic correlation with smoking and psychiatric traits was identified, emphasizing its role in nicotine consumption.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: This SNP was part of the region identified in CHRNA5, known for its functional significance in nicotine consumption, contributing to the genetic basis of TUD.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The SNP rs55990066 related to SLC28A1 was positively associated with 5,6-dihydrouridine, indicating its role in nucleoside transport.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs55901542 in SORD was associated with ribitol levels, linking it to polyol metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs62021480 was significantly associated with pregnancy loss, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 3.29 and a P-value of 7.83×10^-11. This variant is located on chromosome 15 and encodes a synonymous variant in the gene RMGA, which is believed to guide developing axons and may act as a tumor suppressor.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The rs17762839 SNP related to OTUD7A showed a significant association with endometriosis, having a p-value of 1.72E-08. It was noted in the AMR meta-analysis, indicating its contribution to the understanding of endometriosis.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: This SNP was linked to cancer-related traits, demonstrating potential relevance in cancer susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The SNP rs55760279 in the ALDH1A2 gene area was identified as one of the novel loci associated with knee pain, scoring a p value of 1.29 × 10^-14. ALDH1A2 encodes an enzyme critical for retinoic acid synthesis, which regulates gene expression during cartilage health; alterations in its function may compromise cartilage integrity.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: Located in the ALDH1A2 gene area on chromosome 15, rs2899611 showed a significant association with knee pain in males with a p value of 2.77 × 10^-11. This finding aligns with the role of ALDH1A2 in cartilage health, further emphasizing sex-specific genetic mechanisms.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: SNP rs2033939 at 15q14 was associated with CT in the postcentral gyrus, recording a strong association with a p-value of 2.7×10^-15. This SNP had been previously reported in three GWAS as associated with CT in the same brain region.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The variant rs1080066 at 15q14 showed significant association with CT in the postcentral gyrus with a p-value of 5.6×10^-15. It was highlighted in two recent GWAS where it was associated with cortical area in the precentral gyrus.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: This intronic ADAMTSL3 variant showed a strong association with ASATadjBMI (P = 2.2 x 10^-17) and was linked to various fat ratios indicating a general signal for subcutaneous adiposity.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: In strong linkage disequilibrium with rs768397327, this intronic variant indicated a signal associated with subcutaneous fat distribution traits.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs28624578 linked to <italic>KLF13</italic> demonstrated strong allelic imbalance suggesting a significant role in chromatin accessibility, ultimately leading to altered gene expression patterns that correlate with increased risk factors.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: The analysis revealed that rs28510484 plays a significant role as a locus for psoriasis, showing that the risk allele correlates with increased expression of the <italic>KLF13</italic> gene, confirming its positive association with chromatin states related to autoimmune pathways.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs4702, located in the 5' UTR of the FURIN gene, was associated with OCD. It is known to be an eQTL, where the risk G allele correlated with decreased expression, implicating altered gene expression in OCD.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies new loci associated with OCD

finding: The rs176647 SNP in the 15q26.1 region was linked to the fractional anisotropy (FA) of the posterior limb of internal capsule, indicating influence on insomnia.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Although just below GW significance in cross-ancestry analysis, this SNP associated with the FURIN gene had previously shown significance in multiple cardiovascular and addiction-related outcomes, further establishing its connections to risk factors for OUD.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The rs16969968 variant, located in the CHRNA5 gene, was found to be associated with smoking behaviors, specifically in relation to cessation. Participants with the higher risk genotypes (GA/AA) demonstrated greater abstinence with varenicline compared to placebo, indicating that this SNP affects treatment response in a way that can be utilized in precision cessation therapies.
title: Smoking, race, ancestry and prospective abstinence

finding: The SNP rs9920763 (TP53BP1) was confirmed with a P-value of 1.63×10^-8 for overall lung cancer in the multi-ancestry meta-analysis.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: The low frequency variant rs149336329 increased MYO5C expression and conferred protection against type 2 diabetes. It was located in regulatory regions significant for human islet gene expression.
title: Identification of novel type 1 and type 2 diabetes genes by co-localization of human islet eQTL and GWAS variants with colocRedRibbon

finding: The SNP rs34593439 was noted to have a protective A allele associated with reduced islet CTSH expression, contributing to its link with type 1 diabetes risk through inflammatory responses.
title: Identification of novel type 1 and type 2 diabetes genes by co-localization of human islet eQTL and GWAS variants with colocRedRibbon

finding: This variant had been shown to reduce islet CTSH expression and was in linkage disequilibrium with rs34593439, reinforcing its potential role in type 1 diabetes.
title: Identification of novel type 1 and type 2 diabetes genes by co-localization of human islet eQTL and GWAS variants with colocRedRibbon

finding: This SNP was implicated in fatty acid traits with evidence suggesting a role in lipid metabolism through colocalization analyses.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Identified as a potential causal variant for fatty acid traits, confirming its relevance in genetic studies.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: The SNP chr15:91426560:G:A was identified as a strong putative causal variant for the gene FURIN in connection with schizophrenia, although it did not reach genome-wide significance in the EAS population.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: SNP rs17601876 located at 15q21.2 showed a significant pleiotropic effect between endometrial cancer and COVID-19, with a P-value of 3.07×10−14.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The SNP rs12913832, located in the HERC2 gene, was significantly associated with retinal pigmentation and influenced melanin production through effects on OCA2 expression. It was strongly linked with brown iris colour in European populations.
title: Ethnicity is not biology: retinal pigment score to evaluate biological variability from ophthalmic imaging using machine learning

finding: The SNP rs74653330, associated with the OCA2:c.1327G>A (p.Val443Ile), showed that when present in combination with rs1126809, it significantly increased the risk of albinism diagnosis, exhibiting a strong synergistic effect. This suggests that interactions between the TYR and OCA2 proteins can lead to increased pathology related to albinism, affecting traits such as visual acuity and retinal thickness.
title: The co-occurrence of genetic variants in the TYR and OCA2 genes confers susceptibility to albinism

finding: The study identified SNP rs1800411, which was located in exon 15 of the OCA2 gene. In the context of analyzing blood samples from a patient and her parents, it was discovered that this SNP allowed researchers to determine the inheritance pattern of variants associated with exon 10 skipping. Specifically, the sequencing indicated that all RT-PCR products with skipped exon 10 originated from the maternal allele carrying the variant c.1080C>T. This finding established a direct link between the rs1800411 SNP and the expression patterns in the context of oculocutaneous albinism type 2, thereby supporting its relevance as a pathogenic factor for OCA2.
title: Unsuspected consequences of synonymous and missense variants in OCA2 can be detected in blood cell RNA samples of patients with albinism

finding: rs10468017 was found to be significantly associated with blood pressure-related phospholipids, with implications for traits surrounding metabolism, such as lipoproteins and heart rate.
title: A multi-omics study of circulating phospholipid markers of blood pressure

finding: This SNP rs261338 was identified in the study as having a genome-wide significant association with blood pressure-related phospholipids, correlating with various metabolic traits and blood cell counts.
title: A multi-omics study of circulating phospholipid markers of blood pressure

finding: The SNP rs12439649 was noted for its association with phospholipids linked to blood pressure and various metabolic traits, including significant relationships with lipoproteins.
title: A multi-omics study of circulating phospholipid markers of blood pressure

finding: The SNP rs35828350 was associated with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and was found to downregulate the gene Wdr73 in the adult cortex. This association was statistically significant following the application of the FDR regression model, indicating its importance in the context of psychiatric disorders. Additionally, the neurotransmitter receptor GABBR1, which is significantly downregulated in individuals with ASD, was implicated, suggesting a broader impact on neuronal development and behavior.
title: Discovering additional genetic loci associated with six psychiatric disorders/traits via FDR regression model leveraging external genetic and biological data

finding: The SNP rs4776579 was located in the intron of the MYO9A gene on chromosome 15 and linked to endophenotype T2:66, which was connected to structures including the planum temporale, Heschl's gyrus, and brainstem. The significant association for this SNP had a p-value of 7.41×10−11, demonstrating its importance as a previously unreported genetic variant related to brain structure.
title: New phenotype discovery method by unsupervised deep representation learning empowers genetic association studies of brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs6497118 was found to be part of a genomic region that suggested linkage to congenital prosopagnosia (CP) with a significant LOD score of 3.20, indicating a possible CP-linked gene on chromosome 15.
title: Human Genetics of Face Recognition: Discovery of MCTP2 Mutations in Humans with Face Blindness (Congenital Prosopagnosia)

finding: SNP rs1437588 was identified as part of the linked genomic region on chromosome 15 along with rs6497118, contributing to the higher LOD score associated with potential CP linkage.
title: Human Genetics of Face Recognition: Discovery of MCTP2 Mutations in Humans with Face Blindness (Congenital Prosopagnosia)

finding: The finding related to SNP rs6497114 supported the extended linkage analysis indicating significant genetic correlation to CP, showing LOD scores over 3.
title: Human Genetics of Face Recognition: Discovery of MCTP2 Mutations in Humans with Face Blindness (Congenital Prosopagnosia)

finding: SNP rs12900387 was also associated with significant LOD scores in the linkage analysis, suggesting its relevance to CP.
title: Human Genetics of Face Recognition: Discovery of MCTP2 Mutations in Humans with Face Blindness (Congenital Prosopagnosia)

finding: The SNP rs1573086 contributed to the minimum candidate region (MCR) linked to CP, being shared by all affected individuals but not present in unaffected ones in the analyzed population.
title: Human Genetics of Face Recognition: Discovery of MCTP2 Mutations in Humans with Face Blindness (Congenital Prosopagnosia)

finding: This SNP was reported as an eQTL influencing the expression of several genes, including EFL1 and AB3B2, particularly in adipose and arterial tissues, indicating its potential role in blood pressure regulation.
title: Genome-wide pleiotropy analysis identifies novel blood pressure variants and improves its polygenic risk scores

finding: The SNP rs1051730 on chromosome 15 was associated with smoking cessation during pregnancy and smoking quantity according to Freathy et al. This finding indicated that mothers carrying the rs1051730 risk allele did not have a higher likelihood of smoking initiation compared to non-carriers; however, if they did smoke, they smoked more heavily and found it harder to quit. This gene variant thus moderated the effects of smoking on offspring birth weight, contributing to a significant interaction between maternal genetics and prenatal smoking exposure.
title: Exploring and accounting for genetically driven effect heterogeneity in Mendelian Randomization

finding: The SNP rs3784491, identified in previous analyses, showed marginal significance, while its associated locus near CHSY1 highlighted crucial pathways in bone density regulation.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs11072524, located in an intron of RYR3, served as another interacting SNP and was relevant to the understanding of the disease risk factors in the context of severe long COVID.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Severe and Fatigue Dominant Long COVID and Commonalities with ME/CFS Identified by Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The rs4702 polymorphism was linked with increased expression of FURIN, significant for SARS-CoV-2 infection rates; its frequencies in the Indian population suggested relatively lesser COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: With implications on FURIN expression, the variant rs4932178 demonstrated intermediate frequency levels in Indians, indicating possible moderate susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs17514846 variant, linked to elevated FURIN expression in endothelial cells, showed allele frequency patterns that may influence COVID-19 severity outcomes.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs2120019 variant was associated with increased zinc deficiency risks and exhibited lower frequencies in the Indian population, suggesting a lesser susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: This SNP in RYR3 gene was associated with increased severity of COVID-19, with frequency observations that may indicate a moderate risk level in Indians.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: Located near CYP1A1, this variant was associated with lung cancer, showing significant colocalization effects in lung tissue, thus being designated as a positive original finding.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: This sentinel variant related to lung cancer was highlighted as having a substantial effect in the study, marking it as a positive original finding.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The cadmium increasing variant rs953733 found in DUOX2 was strongly associated with iron deficiency anemias.
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: This SNP is situated within an intron of Mortality Factor 4 Like 1 (MORF4L1) and had a p-value of 3.88 x 10^-8. Its association in the context of pSSNS suggests a contributory role, potentially affecting disease mechanisms specific to certain populations.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: SNP rs2521501, located near the FES gene, demonstrated robust evidence for association with hypertension, reinforcing the gene's relevance despite its unclear mechanism of action.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects implicates genes involved in increased and decreased risk of hypertension

finding: At TICRR, SNP rs140496989 was noted to have a significant association with HbF, reporting a beta of -0.43 and a P-value of 3.34 x 10^-8.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: The SNP rs201563586 was identified as a highly Finnish-enriched missense variant with a high causal probability further contributing an independent signal at the LIPC locus that was not in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with previously reported variants. This indicated its potential as a significant variant in Finnish genetics.

The SNP rs121907970 was part of the significant association analysis for proxy Alzheimer's disease. It caused an amino acid substitution linked to a reduction in Hex A activity, although the implications for protein function specifically in the brain were less clear.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs2088635643 was identified as an ultra-rare high-confidence missense variant contributing to the association with proxy Alzheimer's disease, leading to a substitution that was not predicted to affect protein function.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs147301839 near GCOM1 was identified as having a significant association with AF, showcasing its relevance in AF pathogenesis.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: The SNP rs12438724 was associated with fibrotic idiopathic interstitial pneumonias, with a p-value of 4.10 × 10^-8, and has been connected to cholesterol levels in blood serum.
title: Enhancing genotype-phenotype association with optimized machine learning and biological enrichment methods

finding: The SNP rs113446150 was identified in a meta-analysis as significant in relation to rare neurodevelopmental conditions, with a p-value of 4.0x10^-8. Variants in its locus were associated with cognitive traits, indicating its contribution to neurodevelopmental risk through a genetic mechanism.
title: Dissecting the contribution of common variants to risk of rare neurodevelopmental conditions

finding: The SNP rs528002287, located in the gene PCSK6, was identified as a unique risk variant for stroke in South Asia. It was linked to cardioembolic stroke and small vessel stroke within this population. The study noted that PCSK6 regulates sodium homeostasis, which is crucial in diastolic blood pressure maintenance. An association was found between the expression of PCSK6 and hypertension, with a reported 2.34-fold difference in expression during hypertension's maintenance phase.
title: Ethnic and region-specific genetic risk variants of stroke and its comorbid conditions can define the variations in the burden of stroke and its phenotypic traits

finding: Identified as part of the 42 SNPs associated with common liability, rs281287 contributed to the genetic architecture linked to addiction, but specific phenotypic associations were not detailed.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: Associated with nicotine use, SNP rs76474922 was identified as an intron variant on the CHRNA5 gene, linking it to the pathophysiology of nicotine addiction.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: The rs4702 G allele was previously associated with schizophrenia. It was found to cause downregulation of FURIN expression, which in turn impacted BDNF (Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor) production. This finding indicated that such genetic variations may play a significant role in neuropsychiatric disorders, highlighting a potential link to PTSD mechanisms.
title: Altered gene expression and PTSD symptom dimensions in World Trade Center responders

finding: Associated with TICRR and KIF7, this SNP was significant for understanding low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The study reported that rs281238 exhibited a significant interaction with parental education (PE) on reading ability. Specifically, children with the "T" genotype benefitted from high PE environments but performed poorly in low PE environments. In contrast, children with the "CC" genotype showed no variation in reading ability across different PE environments. This finding conforms to the differential-susceptibility model.
title: Interaction between risk SNPs of Developmental Dyslexia and Parental Education on Reading Ability: Evidence for Differential-Susceptibility Theory

finding: Identified as the most significant SNP for the FURIN gene in neurons, which has been associated with multiple psychiatric disorders. This SNP also aligned with the findings from bipolar disorder (BIP) GWAS, highlighting its role as a potential causal mediator in the pathology.
title: A unified framework for cell-type-specific eQTLs prioritization by integrating bulk and scRNA-seq data

finding: The SNP rs8042149 was identified as having a genome-wide significant association with PTSD. This finding was specifically noted in a study involving veterans and their intimate partners, establishing a direct link to the RORA gene.
title: An Expert-guided Hierarchical Graph Attention Network for Post-traumatic Stress Disorder Highly-associative Genetic Biomarkers Identification

finding: SNP rs117618017 was found to regulate CA12 expression in the caudate nucleus and is located near APH1B, which was robustly associated with AD risk in GWAS, highlighting its relevance to AD pathology.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of Alzheimer disease reveals many differentially expressed genes and multiple biological pathways in brain tissue from African American donors

finding: The SNP rs11071366 was identified as a key risk variant for Hand OA. It was associated with increased methylation at the methylation quantitative trait locus (mQTL) cg12031962, where the risk allele A correlated with decreased DNA methylation. This finding was initially discovered in studies of osteochondral tissue and was replicated in foetal cartilage.
title: Epigenetic mechanisms of osteoarthritis risk in human skeletal development

finding: The effect of SNP rs12915901 was evaluated in relation to the ALDH1A2 gene, associated with all-trans retinoic acid synthesis. The allele was linked to decreased expression and DNA methylation changes, indicating its functional relevance in OA risk mechanisms.
title: Epigenetic mechanisms of osteoarthritis risk in human skeletal development

finding: The SNP rs12440045 was part of the top SNPs identified that potentially affect transcription factor binding and correlate with gene target expression.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The SNP rs7172038 was identified as the most likely causal variant (PIP = 0.99) in the HCN4 locus, which is associated with Atrial Fibrillation (AF). It was located within a cardiomyocyte-specific open chromatin region and was shown to interact with the promoter of the HCN4 gene. This gene is critical for cardiac rhythm control, highlighting the SNP's role in AF genetics.
title: Single-cell genomics improves the discovery of risk variants and genes of Atrial Fibrillation

finding: The analysis identified the SNP rs28457673 as being part of a novel signaling pathway associated with post-stroke depression, which suggested potential implications in the underlying mechanisms of mood disorders, including bipolar disorder. The research highlighted a network that relates this SNP to various biological pathways, bolstering its significance in understanding genetic contributions to mood disorders.
title: A characteristic cerebellar biosignature for bipolar disorder, identified with fully automatic machine learning

finding: The SNP rs2414098 was reported as an intronic variant in the gene CYP19A1, which encodes an enzyme that converts testosterone to estradiol. The analysis indicated that there was an increased risk of overall breast cancer (BC) and estrogen receptor positive (ER+) BC associated with this SNP, with odds ratios of 1.03 (95% CI: 1.01-1.06) for overall BC and 1.06 (95% CI: 1.03-1.09) for ER+ BC. However, it showed no significant impact on estrogen receptor negative (ER-) BC risk with an odds ratio of 1.01 (95% CI: 0.96-1.05). This suggested that the influence of estradiol on BC risk may be independent of testosterone, reinforcing the biological relevance of rs2414098 in hormone interaction and breast cancer pathophysiology.
title: Sex steroid hormones and risk of breast cancer incidence and survival: A two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP chr15:90797341:G:A was specifically involved in the African ancestry analysis and located within BLM gene, which is essential for resolving G-quadruplex structures in telomere replication.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: The splice acceptor variant rs201988637 in MFGE8 showed a protective effect against coronary atherosclerosis with an odds ratio of 0.72 (p = 7.94x10^-06). It was also enriched in Finland and independent of rs534125149, indicating both variants exert their effects independently against coronary atherosclerosis and myocardial infarction.
title: Loss-of-function of MFGE8 and protection against coronary atherosclerosis

finding: The SNP rs62023078 was located at the 15q22.31 locus and had a combined odds ratio of 1.17 (P = 4.97 x 10^-10). It resided intronically in HERC1, an E3 ubiquitin ligase, and showed significant eQTL associations where the risk allele was linked to varying expression levels of multiple genes, further implicating this locus in febrile seizure susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide association study of febrile seizures identifies seven new loci implicating fever response and neuronal excitability genes

finding: Yang et al. utilized the rs16969968 variant in CHRNA5 to validate a proxy gene-by-environment Mendelian randomisation (G×E MR) approach. This approach was used to replicate the known effect of maternal smoking heaviness on offspring birthweight, providing evidence of a transgenerational causal effect. Yang et al. subsequently applied this method to explore the impacts of maternal smoking on later life outcomes for the offspring, reinforcing the importance of considering maternal exposures in relation to offspring health.
title: A systematic literature review of methodological approaches, challenges, and opportunities in the application of Mendelian randomisation to lifecourse epidemiology

finding: The intronic SNP rs17601876 in the CYP19A1 gene related to higher heel bone density and an increased risk of endometrial cancer.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The SNP rs602602 showed the hub gene ADAM10 in excitatory neurons as its highest prioritized gene, indicating a role in Alzheimer's pathology.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The SNP rs35483472 was significantly linked to educational attainment, with a p-value of 3 × 10^-12, suggesting its influence on cognitive or educational outcomes.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs117799466 was associated with alcohol consumption, having a p-value of 3 × 10^-9, indicating its potential role in alcohol-related behaviors.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs8039126 was significantly associated with mean platelet volume, with a p-value of 2 × 10^-11, suggesting its relevance in thrombocyte function.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs78319531 exhibited an association with hepatic protein levels, supported by a p-value of 3 × 10^-8, indicating its potential impact on liver function.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: This SNP was part of the replicated findings from meta-analyses, contributing evidence for its importance in age-related ocular comorbidities.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: This variant was part of three aggregate associations that were linked to the genes MRPL46 and MRPS11 on chromosome 15. It contributed significantly to the test statistics indicating a regulatory role concerning type 2 diabetes.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: Along with rs145197571 and rs28427880, this variant was involved in driving aggregate associations at the chromosome 15 locus, reinforcing the notion of shared regulatory mechanisms relevant to T2D.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: This variant contributed alongside rs145197571 and rs79569357 to associations on chromosome 15, again reflecting its potential role in the regulation of gene expression pertinent to type 2 diabetes.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The obesity-related PLIN1 gene polymorphism rs1052700 influenced the relationship between meal timing and weight loss. Specifically, AA carriers who ate lunch late were found to lose less weight than those who had lunch early, while TT carriers did not experience any difference in weight loss based on meal timing. This indicated that genetic factors could modify weight loss outcomes based on when meals were consumed.
title: Circadian meal timing is heritable and associated with insulin sensitivity

finding: Identified as significant for DED through genome-wide association studies, SNP rs78027155 played a role in the observed gene-environment interactions related to hot spring exposure.
title: Hot Spring Residency and Disease Association: a Crossover Gene-Environment Interaction (GxE) Study in Taiwan

finding: The SNP rs1531817 at the PCSK6 locus showed an experiment-wide significant signal with PAD and low density lipoprotein (LDL) (bivariate P=3.2×10−10). This signal was independent from a coding variant previously associated with LDL, indicating a new linkage at this locus. Additionally, it affected the splicing of PCSK6 in human liver tissue, where the A allele led to exon 14 exclusion, resulting in increased activity of the active isoform of PCSK6 that is involved in lipid metabolism.
title: Multi-trait GWAS of atherosclerosis detects novel pleiotropic loci

finding: The SNP rs12913832 mapped to the HERC2-OCA2 locus was associated with determining eye color and also linked to the risk of hemoglobinopathies, demonstrating a beta of -0.35 with a p-value less than 10^-762.
title: A predictive atlas of disease onset from retinal fundus photographs

finding: The rs3825942 variant was confirmed to be a main signal associated with exfoliation syndrome, which previously has been shown to overlap with primary open-angle glaucoma associations.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: There were significant male-female differences noted with this SNP, where it had a negative effect on the inflammation component (PC3) in males (-0.50SD) but a positive effect in females (+0.41SD).
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs7182018 was previously associated with increased grey matter volume (GMV) in the central sulcus as well as the aparc-Desikan rh pars triangularis volume. This finding related to variations in brain measurements, particularly in how GMV was impacted by genetic variations within the AC013652.1 gene region.
title: The impact of Short Tandem Repeats on grey matter brain imaging derived phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The lead variant rs55707100 was associated with antithrombin and PC levels, with strong significance in the analyses, indicating it as a potential novel locus influencing these phenotypes.
title: Antithrombin, protein C and protein S: Genome and transcriptome wide association studies identify 7 novel loci regulating plasma levels

finding: The rs139566989 variant in the LIPC gene was found to interact almost exclusively with body fat-related measures, enhancing the positive association between body mass index (BMI) and serum triglycerides (TG). The insertion variant was associated with an increased expression of LIPC and decreased serum triglycerides. It specifically influenced the interactions concerning TG in lipoprotein subfractions such as intermediate-density lipoprotein (IDL) and very large HDL.
title: Variance-quantitative trait loci enable systematic discovery of gene-environment interactions for cardiometabolic serum biomarkers

finding: This missense variant in ADAMTS7 was specifically associated with ascending aortic area in females, demonstrating sex-specific genetic influence.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: This lead SNP for ascending aortic area was notable for being in strong LD with rs28699256, suggesting crucial interactions in sex-specific traits.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: This SNP in the FES gene was recognized as a strong eQTL in the aorta and associated with male-specific traits.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The CYP1A2 variant rs11857376 was analyzed, showing implications for urate production influenced by smoking and other dietary factors, thereby affecting gout risk.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: The SNP rs4702, located in the 3' untranslated region (UTR) of the FURIN gene, was identified within the context of schizophrenia risk loci. It was noted as a sentinel variant associated with the gene, suggesting a potential role in schizophrenia outcomes.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study in isolated human immune cells highlights interferon regulatory transcription factor 3 as a schizophrenia hub gene

finding: The SNP was identified as a cis-pQTL for LTK, causally linked to type-2 diabetes risk with a high posterior probability of colocalisation.
title: Efficient candidate drug target discovery through proteogenomics in a Scottish cohort

finding: This SNP contributed to the discovery of shared genetic features linking BMI and MS as part of the stated 18 novel findings.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: In the linear model focused on pneumonia classification, rs10519203 emerged as the dominant SNP. As an intron variant in the HYKK gene, it has established associations with lung cancer and smoking behavior, suggesting its profiling may relate more to patient history rather than a direct infection risk, thus demonstrating its multifaceted role in health outcomes.
title: An assessment of the value of deep neural networks in genetic risk prediction for surgically relevant outcomes

finding: The rs117618017 variant in APH1B demonstrated a significant association with LOAD and a P-value of 2.10×10^-13 in stage 2, indicating a novel contribution to the genetic risk of Alzheimer's disease.
The SNP rs3896609 related to the ATF5/SIGLEC11 locus showed significance with a P-value of 4.84×10^-9 in stage 3, further supporting its role in Alzheimer's disease susceptibility.
The variant rs3131610 near USP50 (associated with SPPL2A) showed significance with a P-value of 1.35×10^-8 in stage 3, highlighting its potential role in LOAD.

The lead SNP rs139939693, located intronic to the USP3 gene, was linked to a smaller aortic root diameter and was predictive of aortic stenosis. This gene had previous associations with cardiovascular traits including atrial fibrillation and ECG morphology.
title: Using Machine Learning to Elucidate the Spatial and Genetic Complexity of the Ascending Aorta

finding: The variant rs551013446 in RORA on 15q22.22 demonstrated a strong genetic signal in association with lung cancer, previously highlighted in studies of asthma.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The rare variant rs115735578 in LAMN1L on 15q24.1 was associated primarily with squamous cell carcinoma, notably within African-ancestry populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Located near COPS2-SECISBP2L on 15q21.1, this variant was strongly associated with lung cancer, showing consistent directionality across populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs117564279 displayed a strong effect on mJSW (β 0.15, P 1.35×10^-8) and a weaker association with HOA (β 0.06, P 0.07), indicating it had a significant mJSW impact but no height association.
title: Hip joint space width is causally related to hip osteoarthritis risk via distinct protective and susceptibility mechanisms: findings from a genome-wide association study meta-analysis

finding: The genetic variant rs17225178 in the ARNT2 gene was associated with Asperger Syndrome. This finding highlighted its significance in relation to the diagnosis of autism spectrum conditions, particularly in understanding AS as a potential distinct subtype within the broader context of ASD.
title: Genetic networks suggest Asperger’s Syndrome as a distinct subtype of Autism Spectrum Conditions

finding: SPPL2A:rs59685680-G also displayed protective characteristics, consistent with findings of resilience to AD.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs936227 was tied to the protein ULK3, and like the others, it contributed significantly to the colocalization with BMI, dietary habits, and respective protein levels, with the majority being attributed to this variant.
title: Genetic control of body weight by the human brain proteome

finding: The SNP rs1051730 was analyzed as an instrumental variable for maternal smoking during pregnancy, demonstrating that the presence of the A allele was associated with an increased number of cigarettes smoked per day. This SNP was consistently linked to a reduction in offspring birth weight, with estimates suggesting that having one A allele decreased birth weight by approximately 17 grams among smoking mothers. In contrast, it showed no significant relationship with birth weight among non-smoking mothers, indicating that the SNP's effect on birth weight operated solely through maternal smoking.
title: The Interplay between Maternal Smoking and Genes in Offspring Birth Weight

finding: The CGNL1 SNP rs17239735 exhibited a genome-wide significant interaction with the ε2 allele, indicating that its effect on AD risk was dependent on the presence of the ε2 allele. This interaction further supported the evidence connecting CGNL1 to AD, particularly in the analysis of multiple brain omics data.
title: Protein phosphatase 2A, complement component 4, and APOE genotype linked to Alzheimer’s disease using a systems biology approach

finding: The rs7173743 SNP was found in the MORF4L1 locus on chromosome 15, which similarly showed local genetic correlation between T1D and CAD. This indicated its potential impact on the genetic determinants associated with these disorders.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: The rs72743461 SNP was part of the SMAD3 locus on chromosome 15 and demonstrated local genetic correlation with eosinophil count exclusively, highlighting its specific association with one of the leukocyte measures linked to CAD.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: Located within the SMAD3 locus on chromosome 15 like rs72743461, the rs17293632 SNP also showed local genetic correlation exclusively with eosinophil count, contributing to the understanding of how genetic loci relate specifically to this leukocyte measure.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: This SNP was associated with regional myocardial-wall thickness at end-diastole (WT AHA 7) and colocalized with schizophrenia, suggesting genetic pleiotropy between cardiac and psychiatric conditions.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: This SNP was associated with functional connectivity between the default mode and orbito-affective networks, highlighting its significance in neural connectivity.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs17514846 was identified as a shared causal variant between PTSD and the global myocardial-wall thickness at end-diastole within locus 15q21.31, with a high colocalization probability (H4-PP=92.5%).
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The study identified the variant c.5125A>G (p.T1709A) in the STRC gene, which was characterized as the only divergent nucleotide between STRC and its pseudogene STRCP1. Predictive scores and ClinVar assertions indicated that this variant was likely pathogenic.
title: Comprehensive genetic analysis of STRC variants in hereditary hearing impairment using long-read sequencing

finding: The SNP rs16969968, located at the CHRNA5 locus, was found to be associated with smoking intensity. In the context of weight change, the analysis indicated a complex relationship where current smokers experienced weight loss, while former smokers showed weight gain. This suggests that rs16969968 had a genetically predicted effect on weight change conditions predisposing individuals to these smoking-related weight dynamics.
title: Estimating the genetically predicted effects of lifestyle risk factors, educational attainment and Alzheimer’s disease liability on weight change during midlife

finding: This intronic variant of <italic>LIPC</italic> was associated with HDL cholesterol.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs572198006 had a lower frequency of HRG in females with an onset age of 45 or younger (11%) compared to females with later onset (4%) and male cases (6%). This finding indicated a potential genetic influence on the type of TN cases presenting based on demographic factors.
title: Role of common and rare genetic variants in the aetiology of trigeminal neuralgia

finding: The SNP rs72740082, associated with the gene FAH, was found to have significant associations with suicide attempts among individuals of African ancestries and replicated in independent samples.
title: Clinical, genomic, and neurophysiological correlates of lifetime suicide attempts among individuals with alcohol dependence

finding: The SNP rs2472297, a known regulator of CYP1A2 activity, was involved in a significant association with ANC in the context of clozapine use; however, the association of CYP1A2 activity with ANC was notably independent of this SNP. This highlights the importance of CYP1A2 metabolism in influencing neutrophil counts during clozapine therapy.
title: Mediation and Longitudinal Analysis to interpret the association between clozapine pharmacokinetics, pharmacogenomics, and absolute neutrophil count

finding: This AD GWAS SNP overlapped the APH1B promoter in oligodendrocytes, suggesting this region's relevance in gene regulation related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs117618017 was part of a credible set with a PP exceeding 0.8, highlighting its association with Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: was connected to regulation of tumor cell mobility, implicated in various cancers and its expression was downregulated in certain malignancies.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: This SNP was associated with a lowered likelihood of FGID, conferring 0.45 times the likelihood of being an IBD sufferer.
title: Digital Therapeutics Care Utilizing Genetic and Gut Microbiome Signals for the Management of Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders: Results from a Preliminary Retrospective Study

finding: This SNP represented a Finnish-enriched variant p.Thr967Met in LRRK1, which displayed significant association with DD (OR = 3.18, p = 1.51 × 10^-16), underscoring its relevance.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This SNP yielded a genome-wide significant association in the meta-analysis (OR = 0.92, p = 5.73 × 10^-9), indicating its potential role related to LRRK1.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This lead SNP (OR = 1.14, p = 6.54 × 10^-20) replicated the association at the NEDD4 gene locus, which has connections to lung fibrosis.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: The intronic variant rs8032158 was in complete LD with rs67505007 and linked to keloid formation predisposition.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This lead SNP (OR = 0.92, p = 1.88 × 10^-8) was associated with a deleterious variant in AKAP13, which has been implicated in interstitial pulmonary fibrosis.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This missense variant was linked to AKAP13 and outlined a potential shared genetic risk between DD and other fibrotic diseases.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This SNP was one of the lead variants previously associated with DD and strengthened the understanding of its genetic background.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: The SNP rs1051730, located within the nicotine acetylcholine receptor gene cluster CHRNA5-CHRNA3-CHRNB4 on chromosome 15, was associated with a higher likelihood of continuing smoking during pregnancy, contributing to increased placental weight. Each additional copy of the risk allele was linked to an increase of approximately one cigarette smoked per day, underscoring its role in smoking behavior. This finding was critical as it demonstrated that continued smoking in mothers during pregnancy resulted in higher placental weights at delivery, as substantiated by the Meta-analysis showing a 175 g increase in placental weight for those who continued smoking compared to those who quit.
title: Smoking during pregnancy and its effect on placental weight: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs2290572 represented the lead sQTL for ULK3, showing significant associations in coronary artery tissue, connecting it to various CAD-relevant traits.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The genetic variant rs3825991 in RLBP1 demonstrated a strong association (P = 2.70 x 10<sup>-31</sup>) with photoreceptor layer thickness; mutations in RLBP1 are known to cause various retinal dystrophies.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The study reported rs11634109 at NEIL1 as significantly associated with early AMD (p-value = 4.27 x 10^-5), thus providing new insights into potential genetic risk factors for AMD progression.
title: Integrating explainable machine learning and transcriptomics data reveals cell-type specific immune signatures underlying macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs16969968, located in the CHRNA5 gene, was associated with brain reactivity to smoking images specifically in nicotine-dependent women. This finding related to cue reactivity, an important aspect of understanding the neurocognitive mechanisms underlying substance use disorders.
title: A Methodological Checklist for fMRI Drug Cue Reactivity Studies: Development and Expert Consensus

finding: The rs11556089 SNP in the SMAD3 gene showed a weak association with Parkinson's disease. This SNP was located in the 3' UTR of the gene and suggested a potential influence on mRNA translation. The analysis produced an odds ratio of 0.49 (95% CI 0.26–0.93, p = 0.0375), indicating some degree of association, although it was not as robust as that of rs8179181.
title: TGFB1 rs8179181 polymorphism is reproducibly associated with Parkinson’s disease in a Spanish population

finding: The SNP rs2472297 was highlighted as a causal signal within the CYP1A1/1A2 locus, influencing both clozapine and norclozapine plasma concentrations. It demonstrated a strong causal association, with a posterior probability (PPI=1), and was emphasized for its role in the early metabolism pathway of clozapine.
title: Pharmacokinetics and pharmacogenomics of clozapine in an ancestrally diverse sample: A longitudinal analysis and GWAS using clinical monitoring data from the UK

finding: This SNP, linked to the ANXA2 gene, was found to increase the risk of stroke in SCD patients with an odds ratio of 1.97 (95% CI 1.25-3.11). Annexin A2 is known to be implicated in coagulation processes, making it a relevant finding in the context of strokes.
title: Genetic variants associated with the risk of stroke in sickle cell disease: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The rs2251086 variant at the VPS13C locus was listed among the highest PAR estimates across all populations analyzed, suggesting a universal impact in Parkinson's disease etiology.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: The variant rs6598541-A was associated with an increase in fasting glucose levels of 0.0114 mmol/L [0.0097-0.0131] and was noted to be related to both T2D and fasting glucose variance, showcasing its relevance in glucose metabolism.
title: Damaging missense variants in IGF1R implicate a role for IGF-1 resistance in the aetiology of type 2 diabetes

finding: The lead T2D SNP rs59646751-T was associated with a modestly increased risk of T2D by an odds ratio of 1.024 [1.020-1.028], indicating its significance in the genetic factors contributing to T2D susceptibility.
title: Damaging missense variants in IGF1R implicate a role for IGF-1 resistance in the aetiology of type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs12916839, linked to the gene FGF7, demonstrated strong allelic specific associations and functioning as both a splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) and expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) across multiple tissues.
title: Integrated multi-omics data analysis identifies a novel genetics-risk gene of IRF4 associated with prognosis of oral cavity cancer
