title: Cell type and condition specific functional annotation of schizophrenia associated non-coding genetic variants

finding: rs35346340 showed no allelic difference in activity under stimulation but exhibited lower expression for the C allele under TTX treatment. This pattern of activity was consistent with the observed eQTL influence on the FES gene, highlighting its involvement in schizophrenia-related gene expression regulation.
title: Cell type and condition specific functional annotation of schizophrenia associated non-coding genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs140068312 was part of the 180-SNP polygenic risk score (PRS) constructed for assessing breast cancer risk in Latinas, contributing to the overall findings of the study.
title: A polygenic risk score for breast cancer in U.S. Latinas and Latin-American women

finding: The noncoding common variant rs112917869 within the intron of the THSD4 gene also reached genome-wide significance in relation to sucralose bitterness ratings, suggesting a genetic influence on the perception of sweeteners.
title: Worldwide study of the taste of bitter medicines and their modifiers

finding: The SNP rs1800414 was identified in multiple studies as being related to light skin evolution in East Asians. Its association with the light skin phenotype indicated that it played a significant role in the evolutionary adaptation of skin tone specifically within East Asian populations.
title: Ancient DNA supports that the evolution of Skin Tone in East Asians intensified after their split with Native Americans

finding: The SNP rs74653330 was one of the 6 SNPs identified as associated with light skin in East Asians. The study included beta values for this SNP, positioning it as relevant in the context of understanding the genetic basis of light skin tone adaptations.
title: Ancient DNA supports that the evolution of Skin Tone in East Asians intensified after their split with Native Americans

finding: Variant rs10519203 was reported in the context of pack-years of smoking impacting WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub>. Despite the challenges in its interpretation due to pleiotropy, it remains a focal point of the relationship between smoking duration and abdominal fat.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: Variant rs150353 was also related to the effects of pack-years of smoking on both WC and HC, marking it as significant in understanding the obesity mechanisms linked to smoking.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The rs1317286 variant, associated with smoking heaviness traits, demonstrated a causal relationship exclusively influencing the positive association of cigarettes per day with WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub>. This variant stands out due to its strong association with smoking behavior.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The A to G mutation at rs12913832 in HERC2 served as the primary determinant of blue eye colour. This finding was significant as it indicated a point mutation that reduced the activity of the OCA2 promoter, contributing to iris depigmentation. The derived G allele associated with blue eye colour showed evidence of positive selection in European populations, particularly in those with the highest frequencies located at northern latitudes.
title: Effect of iris pigmentation of blue and brown eyed individuals with European ancestry on ability to see in low light conditions after a short-term dark adaption period

finding: Only three individuals carried the rs12913832-G allele, which related to blue eye color. Seven had the A allele associated with brown eye color, while eight had both alleles.
title: Neolithic genomes reveal a distinct ancient HLA allele pool and population transformation in Europe

finding: This SNP was linked to schizophrenia, reinforcing its relevance in psychiatric genetic research.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The SNP rs35811129 was identified as a disease onset-delaying variant associated with increased FAN1 expression. This variant was linked to a delay in disease onset by reducing somatic CAG expansions in the brains of individuals affected by Huntington's disease (HD) and other neurodegenerative disorders.
title: FAN1 nuclease processes and pauses on disease-associated slipped-DNA repeats: Mechanism against repeat expansions

finding: The SNP rs151322829 was recognized as a coding variant in FAN1 that hastened disease onset for Huntington's disease, where it possibly altered the functionality of the FAN1 protein leading to earlier manifestations of the disease.
title: FAN1 nuclease processes and pauses on disease-associated slipped-DNA repeats: Mechanism against repeat expansions

finding: The SNP rs150393409 was also detected as a coding variant in FAN1 that contributed to hastening the onset of Huntington's disease. Its effects on FAN1 functionalities remain unknown, but its association with increased disease severity was established.
title: FAN1 nuclease processes and pauses on disease-associated slipped-DNA repeats: Mechanism against repeat expansions

finding: The SNP rs3512 was linked with the non-coding region of the FAN1 gene, which was identified as a variant that delays the onset of diseases including Huntington's disease by promoting increased FAN1 expression and reducing somatic CAG expansions.
title: FAN1 nuclease processes and pauses on disease-associated slipped-DNA repeats: Mechanism against repeat expansions

finding: SNP rs8036602, which belongs to the EP300 gene, was found to have significant interactions with brain imaging phenotypes associated with Alzheimer's disease, indicating its possible involvement in the disease pathology.
title: Functional biological paths altered in Alzheimer’s disease: from genes to bile acids

finding: For the rs1380986 SNP associated with autism (AUT), the study indicated a MAF of 0.0006, an Info score of 0.498, and a p-value of 8.01 x 10^-15. These results were interpreted as significant in the context of the AUT phenotype.
title: Increasing the resolution and precision of psychiatric GWAS by re-imputing summary statistics using a large, diverse reference panel

finding: At the RASGRP1 locus, rs55728265 acted as a prioritized finding in strong linkage disequilibrium with the lead variant rs35134214 and overlapped the RASGRP1 promoter, indicating its role in T1D genetic risk.
title: Single-cell gene expression and chromatin accessibility profiling of human pancreatic islets at basal and stimulatory conditions nominates mechanisms of type 1 diabetes genetic risk

finding: The study indicated that the SNP rs11070948 was associated with the gene SCD1, which was found to be crucial for Epstein-Barr virus (EBV)-induced B cell proliferation. The upregulation of SCD1 by EBV and the significance of this SNP were highlighted in the context of cancer, specifically in relation to the therapeutic targeting of SCD1 in cancer treatment, as addressed in the cited publication from Cancers.
title: Fatty acid desaturases link cell metabolism pathways to promote proliferation of Epstein-Barr virus-infected B cells

finding: The CYP19A1 rs2470152 polymorphism was linked to increased susceptibility to depression in the Chinese Han population.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs11070948 was highlighted as significant in the context of targeting Stearoyl-CoA desaturase 1 for cancer treatment, suggesting its relevance in transcriptional regulation and metabolic adaptation in glioblastoma cells as they respond to chemotherapeutic treatment with Temozolomide (TMZ).
title: Mitochondrial sites of contact with the nucleus aid in chemotherapy evasion of glioblastoma cells

finding: Identified as a novel SNP, rs1899754 was associated with hsCRP levels and provided insights into the genetic basis of chronic inflammation.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: This novel SNP was included in the findings associated with hsCRP levels, reinforcing the study's focus on chronic inflammatory responses.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The SNP rs13180, with the minor allele 'T', was found to have a dual impact, as carriers exhibited higher mean values for both cigarettes per day (CPD) (p=8.77×10^-5) and FA measures (p=5.99×10^-5). This SNP played a protective role in maintaining white matter integrity, while simultaneously acting as a risk allele for nicotine addiction. In mediation model analysis, CPD served as a competitive mediator with an indirect effect (p=0.012) opposing the direct effect of the SNP on FA, implicating negative consequences for brain structure related to neurodegeneration and smoking-induced diseases.
title: White matter integrity and nicotine dependence in smokers: evaluating vertical and horizontal pleiotropy

finding: Involved in breast cancer susceptibility in BRCA1 and BRCA2 carriers, this SNP showed distinct frequency differences between Ukrainians and European populations, indicating possible unique risks in Ukrainian women for breast cancer.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: SNP rs2472299 was identified through the ImageNet transferGWAS with a p-value of 3 x 10-10 and was previously associated with systolic and diastolic blood pressure through its proxy SNP rs936226. This SNP achieved a lower p-value in baseline GWAS related to blood pressure, indicating its relevance to cardiovascular traits.
title: TransferGWAS: GWAS of images using deep transfer learning

finding: Proxy for rs2472299 with a high linkage disequilibrium (R2 = 0.81), rs936226 was linked to blood pressure traits and reported a significant p-value in related studies, supporting its role as an important genetic marker for systolic and diastolic blood pressure.
title: TransferGWAS: GWAS of images using deep transfer learning

finding: The SNP rs12913832 in the gene HERC2 was found to interact with another SNP, rs16891982, affecting eye color in Europeans. The analysis revealed significant interaction effects, demonstrating the gene's epistatic role in pigmentation variations among populations.
title: Detection of complex genetic architecture using two-locus population differentiation: modeling epistasis

finding: rs8035987 was identified as a novel risk variant associated with the gene SIN3A, contributing to the genetic landscape of psychiatric disorders.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The SNP rs12913832 was shown to be a common causal variant for eQTL, meQTL, and melanoma risk, regulating <italic>OCA2</italic> expression through an associated enhancer that involves long-range chromatin interaction.
title: Cell-type-specific meQTL extends melanoma GWAS annotation beyond eQTL and informs melanocyte gene regulatory mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs10519203, located in the gene HYKK, demonstrated a strong correlation with other SNPs (r² = 0.97 with rs8042849 and r² = 0.80 with rs72743158) despite being physically distant. This high linkage disequilibrium (LD) suggests that it could harbor shared causal variants affecting traits related to chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) signals. In particular, it was highlighted that the SNP's association with the nicotine addiction trait in the UK Biobank sample indicated its significance in genetic effects on nicotine dependency.
title: Genetic Fine-mapping with Dense Linkage Disequilibrium Blocks: genetics of nicotine dependence

finding: The SNP rs8042849, also located in the HYKK gene, was part of a group of SNPs exhibiting high degrees of correlation (r² = 0.97 with rs10519203 and r² = 0.78 with rs72743158). Even with a physical separation exceeding 100 Kb from rs72743158, it was implicated in shared causal variants linked to tobacco use and COPD traits, suggesting a role in nicotine dependency through its impacts on gene expression.
title: Genetic Fine-mapping with Dense Linkage Disequilibrium Blocks: genetics of nicotine dependence

finding: The SNP rs72743158, located in the CHRNB4 gene, showed significant correlations with both rs10519203 (r² = 0.80) and rs8042849 (r² = 0.78), highlighting its involvement in genetic architectures related to nicotine addiction. The large physical distance from the other SNPs did not diminish its association, reinforcing the concept that distant SNPs can be grouped into the same dense LD block and suggesting shared causal pathways for nicotine dependency and other nicotine-related traits.
title: Genetic Fine-mapping with Dense Linkage Disequilibrium Blocks: genetics of nicotine dependence

finding: The SNP rs16968876 was identified as the top lead variant associated with cortical surface area in a study that analyzed brain morphology across 35,657 participants. This finding was significant, reflecting a substantial increase in the identification of relevant loci through the application of the Multivariate Omnibus Statistical Test (MOSTest) compared to previous genetic studies.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association study identifies 1735 unique genetic loci associated with cortical morphology

finding: The SNP rs8032326 was recognized as the top lead variant associated with cortical thickness. This association was established within the same context of the study on brain morphology, highlighting the effectiveness of applying the MOSTest to vertex-wise structural MRI data.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association study identifies 1735 unique genetic loci associated with cortical morphology

finding: The SNP rs16968876 was identified as the top hit in a genome-wide association study focused on sulcal depth, a measure of localized cortical folding. The findings indicated a strong association between this SNP and sulcal depth, which has implications for understanding neurodevelopmental processes and overall human cortical morphology.
title: The genetic architecture of human cortical folding

finding: The SNP rs8040868 in the CHRNA3 gene was found to be significantly associated with a higher number of cigarettes per day (CPD) in patients with substance use disorders (SUDs), indicating that variations at this locus may influence smoking behavior.
title: Gene-Gene interactions and pleiotropy in the brain nicotinic pathway associated with the heaviness and precocity of tobacco smoking among outpatients with multiple substance use disorders

finding: The interaction of rs11072793 with rs4758042 also indicated a significant association related to the AAO of daily smoking, building upon the findings of shared genetic influences on this smoking behavior.
title: Gene-Gene interactions and pleiotropy in the brain nicotinic pathway associated with the heaviness and precocity of tobacco smoking among outpatients with multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs12913832, an intronic variant of HERC2, functioned as an enhancer regulating OCA2 expression for hair and skin colour. It was significantly associated with blonde hair (P = 2.87 x 10^-56) and skin colour (P = 5.33 x 10^-191), marking it as an original non-additive finding.
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs2033937 was associated with stronger chromosomal contacts with the THBS1 promoter located approximately 250 kb away in primary monocytes. Validation of the effect was performed using allele-specific 4C-seq, confirming its impact on chromosomal contacts.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The trimodal QTL rs12438271 overlapped with signals associated with mean platelet volume and showed evidence for causal mediation involving chromatin contact.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs17514846 was identified as a lead genetic variant associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) susceptibility. The A allele of this SNP was found to be linked to increased risk for CAD. Investigations revealed that the C allele of rs17514846 is located within a methylated CpG site, which inhibits expression of the FURIN gene through binding of the transcription factor MeCP2 to the methylated DNA. Conversely, the A allele, which does not have this methylated CpG site, resulted in higher expression levels of FURIN in monocytes, indicating an allele-specific effect on FURIN expression driven by DNA methylation dynamics.
title: Allele-specific epigenetic regulation of FURIN expression at a coronary artery disease susceptibility locus

finding: The SNP rs4932198 was associated with a region on chromosome 15 near the ACAN gene, which is implicated in short stature and skeletal dysplasia syndromes. This locus exhibited a density of 25 genome-wide significant (GWS) SNPs clustered within 100 kb of one another, suggesting the presence of multiple independent causal variants. The 25 independent GWS SNPs within this locus explained over 40% of the variable-number-of-tandem-repeat (VNTR) length variation in multiple ancestries, as well as an additional 0.24% of phenotypic variance in EUR, highlighting the role of multiple types of genetic variations in influencing height through the function of the ACAN gene.
title: A Saturated Map of Common Genetic Variants Associated with Human Height from 5.4 Million Individuals of Diverse Ancestries

finding: This SNP was associated with both breast and prostate cancer susceptibility and was confirmed as an independent finding in the context of the new associations.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The unknown locus for AMD near HERC2 was characterized by the lead variant rs12913832, which achieved a genome-wide significance of P=4.7×10^-16 and an EAF of 0.23. However, this association was later identified as a false positive when accounting for misclassification biases related to eye color.
title: Chances and challenges of machine learning based disease classification in genetic association studies illustrated on age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs11071026 was highlighted in the study by Korenchan and Flavell (2019), which addressed the relationship between spatiotemporal pH heterogeneity and cancer progression. This research identified the SNP's role in promoting tumor malignancy through its effects on pH levels in cancer cells, thus connecting it to therapeutic resistance.
title: Single-cell intracellular pH dynamics regulate the cell cycle by timing G1 exit and the G2 transition

finding: This SNP tagged haplotype 15AM1, which was associated with hastened onset of HD and suggested reduced function of FAN1 leading to quicker onset.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: Tagging haplotype 15AM3, this SNP was linked to hastened onset and predicted to disrupt FAN1 function.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: This variant served as a tag for haplotype 15AM2, which was identified with delayed onset associated with higher allele frequencies.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: The variant rs3742971 was found to be negatively associated with the expression of the gene ADAL in multiple neuronal cell types, including D1 MSNs, D2 MSNs, D1/D2 MSNs, and FS interneurons. Lower expression of ADAL in these cell types correlated with AUD, highlighting its potential role in the disorder.
title: Integrated Single-Cell Multiomic Profiling of Caudate Nucleus Suggests Key Mechanisms in Alcohol Use Disorder

finding: The SNP rs11071013 was correlated with variations in Wnt signaling pathways, which were implicated in neuroblastoma. This association suggested that genetic variations at this locus might influence mesenchymal transition processes in this cancer type, consistent with findings in the study by Becker and Wilting (2019), emphasizing its significance in cancer progression.
title: The biotoxin BMAA promotes mesenchymal transition in neuroblastoma cells

finding: The rs1426654 SNP, a G to A substitution, was strongly associated with skin pigmentation in Eurasian populations. It was originally thought that the derived A allele was present at negligible frequencies in Africa, but recent findings revealed it to be at an elevated frequency in East Africa. Analysis suggested that this allele might have been reintroduced into Africa during the out-of-Africa expansion, based on the presence of the same haplotype in East Africans as in Eurasian populations. This raised questions about the introduction frequency of this SNP into Eurasia and prompted further investigation into whether its sweep was consistent with a hard sweep or originated from standing variation, using data from the 1000 Genomes Project.
title: Selective sweeps under dominance and inbreeding

finding: Identified as a novel SNP contributing to breast cancer risk, marking a unique genetic link.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: For the SNP rs111834387, a significant interaction was recorded with the CpG site cg21252175 where predicted mRNA expression levels of TET2 modified the POE. The interaction had discovery and replication p-values of 1.54×10^-6 and 7.76×10^-11 respectively, with lower TET2 expression leading to a reduction in contrast of methylation levels between heterozygous groups.
title: Lifestyle and Genetic Factors Modify Parent-of-Origin Effects on the Human Methylome

finding: The SNP rs12902602 was associated with smoking's modification effect on genetic susceptibility to obesity, particularly in relation to body mass index (BMI). This finding replicated the association reported in a large consortium meta-analysis.
title: A unified method for rare variant analysis of gene-environment interactions

finding: Rs17514846 exhibited eQTL effects for FURIN and FES, supporting multiple candidate gene annotations within the locus.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: The SNP rs11070926 was associated with Wnt/β-catenin signaling in liver cancers, indicating its involvement in mechanisms regulating hepatocyte proliferation. This finding highlighted its role in the repression of mitosis and polyploidy through the regulation of E2F7 and E2F8 by TBX3, contributing to a better understanding of cell cycle progression in the context of liver pathology.
title: Hepatocyte Cell Cycle Progression Depends on a Transcriptional Repressor Cascade Downstream of Wnt Signaling

finding: The regulatory region variant rs577630729 for ISG20 was found to be significantly associated with height. The necessary conditions for recognizing this link involved a thorough investigation of the broader polygenic landscape.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: The SNP rs11071008 was linked to the role of cancer stem cells in ovarian cancer metastasis influenced by mechanical forces. The findings by Bregenzer et al. in 2019 illustrated how mechanical factors and specific genetic variations could affect cancer progression and metastasis.
title: Application of sequential cyclic compression on cancer cells in a flexible microdevice

finding: In the context of the study, the rs16969968 SNP located in the CHRNA5 gene showed a significant association with lower offspring birthweight. Specifically, each additional smoking-increasing allele was associated with a 0.018 kg decrease in birthweight when the mothers smoked during pregnancy (95% CI: -0.026, -0.009). This finding was confirmed using a proxy GxE MR approach, where the offspring genotype served as a proxy for the mother's genotype, thus supporting the previously established causal effect of maternal smoking on offspring birthweight.
title: Proxy gene-by-environment Mendelian randomization study confirms a causal effect of maternal smoking on offspring birthweight, but little evidence of long-term influences on offspring health

finding: The SNP rs8025239 was discovered through the MOSTest in relation to cortical area measures. The replication process utilized a PolyVertex Score (PVS) that aggregated all effects across the cortex, leading to higher replication yields in independent datasets compared to traditional min-P methods. Specifically, replication yielded statistically significant results (p<0.05) for this variant when correlated with the PVS in test data, showcasing its relevance to cortical morphology.
title: Generalization of Cortical MOSTest Genome-Wide Associations Within and Across Samples

finding: Evidence showed that the SNP rs17293632 affected enhancer activity in endothelial cells (ECs), confirmed by CRISPR-mediated deletion leading to significant reduction in SMAD3 expression in HAECs, though lacking an eQTL in HAECs and conflicting eQTL directions in GTEx.
title: Functional non-coding SNPs in human endothelial cells fine-map vascular trait associations

finding: The SNP rs3817428 was associated with height variation within the ACAN gene, suggesting that it had a predicted deleterious effect. It was one of two common missense SNPs that, alongside the ACAN VNTR, contributed to explaining height variance in Europeans.
title: Protein-coding repeat polymorphisms strongly shape diverse human phenotypes

finding: SNP rs34949187 was also linked to the variation in height through its association with the ACAN gene, exhibiting notable predicted deleteriousness and supporting the identification of additional genetic effects when included with the ACAN VNTR in the analysis.
title: Protein-coding repeat polymorphisms strongly shape diverse human phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs7182018 was associated with the pars opercularis area on chromosome 15q14 in the GWASg+r analyses, showing a p-value of 2.2e-60 and explaining 0.83% of the variance. This indicated a significant signal for cortical surface area measurements.
title: Larger cerebral cortex is genetically correlated with greater frontal area and dorsal thickness

finding: The variant rs11639051 at the PCSK6 locus showed a meta-P-value of 1.93 × 10-58, affirming its role in the cytokine network as identified in prior studies.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: The lead CV at the 15q15.1 risk locus, rs937213, was observed as one of the top eQTLs for the HiChIP target gene SRP14, suggesting that this SNP may influence the expression of SRP14 in relation to endometrial cancer risk.
title: Analysis of promoter-associated chromatin interactions reveals biologically relevant candidate target genes at endometrial cancer risk loci

finding: The SNP rs261338 was located within the LIPC gene, which encodes hepatic lipase. The study found that this variant was associated with greater cholesterol content in medium-sized HDLs, leading to an increased cholesterol efflux capacity (β=0.094 [95% CI: 0.013; 0.18], p-value=0.024). This finding suggested a direct relationship between this genetic variant and HDL functionality.
title: High-density lipoprotein characteristics and coronary heart disease: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The variant rs1493699 was identified as a sc-caQTL affecting a master region associated with reduced accessibility while increasing accessibility of a dependent region in MG. However, this variant was not a sc-eQTL of PEAK1 in MG.
title: Integrative single cell multiomics analysis of human retina indicates a role for hierarchical transcription factors collaboration in genetic effects on gene regulation

finding: The synonymous variant rs3825970 in LARP6 was associated with mean reaction time, demonstrating its significant role in cognitive and metabolic pathways.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The synonymous variant rs1549317 in LARP6 was linked to cognitive performance while being highlighted for its regulatory role in gene expression relevant to cognitive processes.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The synonymous variant in THAP10/LRRC49 was found to have significant associations related to cognitive domains, emphasizing its importance in cognitive genetics.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The SNP rs2021013 was related to the antitumor activity of cannabinoids on gliomas through mechanisms involving oxidative stress. This finding is critical in understanding how cannabinoids can influence glioblastoma treatment.
title: Discovery of Novel Small Molecule CB2 Agonist for the Treatment of Glioblastoma Tumors

finding: The SNP rs11070893 was implicated in the context of understanding the relationship between nerves and pancreatic cancer. The mention of this SNP in the study highlighted its potential significance in cancer-related pain and the role of nerve fibers in pancreatic cancer pathology. The findings suggested that this SNP may be associated with neural interactions that could affect cancer growth and pain modulation, supporting the ongoing research into the effects of nerve-related genetic factors on cancer.
title: Cancer-mediated Axonal Guidance of Sensory Neurons in a Microelectrode-based Innervation MPS

finding: The missense variant rs113298164 in LIPC (p.Thr405Met) was associated with 11 traits, including cholesterols, fatty acids, apolipoproteins, and cholines, indicating its significant impact on metabolic features.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: The rs1051730 SNP in the CHRNA3 gene was found to have a significant association with reduced cravings in carriers of the minor allele when smoking one cigarette (beta = -2.46, p=0.04), indicating less craving compared to those homozygous for the major allele. Furthermore, this SNP was correlated with a reduced volume of smoke inhaled per cigarette (beta = -0.24, p=0.01) and per puff (beta = -0.18, p=0.02), suggesting carriers inhaled less smoke. The study thus supported the notion that the rs1051730 genotype influences smoking intensity, related to nicotine dependence as identified in previous genome-wide association studies.
title: Exploration of the role of CHRNA5-A3-B4 genotype in smoking behaviours

finding: The GLCE variant rs3865014 was associated with BMI, blood hemoglobin, hypertension, and cerebrovascular events, indicating its influence on metabolic and vascular health.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs12913832 SNP was found to modulate human pigmentation by affecting chromatin-loop formation between a long-range enhancer and the OCA2 promoter. This mutation contributed to variations in skin pigmentation, demonstrating its significant role in the genetics of pigmentation phenotypes.
title: Enhanced MC1R-signalling and pH modulation facilitate melanogenesis within late endosomes of BLOC-1-deficient melanocytes

finding: For SNP rs11071024, research revealed its role in influencing the metabolic response of liver cancer cells to anthracyclin treatments. The identification of this SNP highlighted its significance in understanding the variability of treatment responses based on alterations in lipid metabolism.
title: Anthracyclins increase free PUFAs and etherPEs with PUFAs as potential hallmarks of lipid peroxidation and ferroptosis

finding: The SNP rs1440802 located in locus 15q14 was associated with functional connectivity (FC) between the precentral gyrus and the dorsal pars opercularis (Prec↔F3opd), as well as the correlation between the precentral gyrus and the Rolandic sulcus (PrecR↔RolS). The minor allele was linked to a phonological linguistic component and semantic processing.
title: The genetic architecture of language functional connectivity

finding: Found to have a significant association with Alzheimer’s disease at a p-value of 4.33 × 10^{-8}, indicating its relevance in the genetic landscape of AD.
title: Deep Learning-based Feature Extraction with MRI Data in Neuroimaging Genetics for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The variant rs7350789 was predicted to increase binding affinity for the NKX2-5 transcription factor and was validated through electrophoretic mobility shift assay (EMSA). However, the specific change in binding affinity could not be quantified due to low binding affinity in the reference sequence.
title: Disease-Associated Non-Coding Variants Alter NKX2-5 DNA-Binding Affinity

finding: FCNsignal was able to pinpoint rs539846 as a causal SNP related to CLL risk variants, successfully aligning with expectations from the study.
title: Base-resolution prediction of transcription factor binding signals by a deep learning framework

finding: The SNP rs1478605 in the 5'-untranslated regions of the THBS1 gene was associated with the development and progression of gastric cancer. This finding was significant in the context of identifying biomarkers for gastric cancer.
title: Investigation of the underlying hub genes and molexular pathogensis in gastric cancer by integrated bioinformatic analyses

finding: The SNP rs11071037 was implicated with AP-1 transcription factors, which are known regulators of immune responses and also play essential roles in cancer. The activation of AP-1 proteins was noted in the context of benzidine-induced cell growth, suggesting a link to bladder cancer pathophysiology.
title: Benzidine Induces Proliferation of UMUC3 Bladder Cancer Cells Through Activation of ERK5 Pathway

finding: This SNP (G39V) involved the replacement of Glycine with Valine at position 39 of the protein, which was predicted to have a damaging effect on the structure and function of the IDH3A protein, linking it to Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: In this case, the Isoleucine at position 46 was replaced by Serine (I46S), predicted to disrupt protein function, and identified as a novel mutation in relation to Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The substitution of Glycine with Cysteine at position 97 (G97C) was predicted to negatively impact the IDH3A protein structure, contributing to the pathogenic profile associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: This mutation (A122T) led to the change of Alanine to Threonine at position 122, which was assessed as having deleterious consequences for the protein function, thus related to Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: This SNP caused Alanine to be replaced by Glutamic Acid at position 122 (A122E), which was noted for its damaging impact on the IDH3A protein, relevant to the disease Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The amino acid Threonine was substituted with Isoleucine at position 172 (T172I), which was identified as detrimental to the protein's structural integrity, thereby linked to Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The change of Arginine to Cysteine at position 178 (R178C) was found to adversely affect the protein, indicating its potential role in Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: This SNP resulted in the replacement of Arginine with Histidine at position 178 (R178H), which was associated with considerable changes in protein structure deemed pertinent to Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: This mutation (Y186C) altered Tyrosine at position 186 to Cysteine, which was determined to influence the IDH3A protein negatively, hence related to Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: In this case, the Valine at position 198 changed to Glycine (V198G), which was assessed to negatively impact protein function and was included in the context of Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The Leucine to Proline substitution at position 210 (L210P) was predicted to have a significant effect on the protein structure, linking it to the etiology of Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The substitution of Proline with Arginine at position 243 (P243R) was evaluated and found to adversely affect the protein, contributing to the pathogenesis of Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The change from Glycine to Arginine at position 268 (G268R) was noted for causing structural consequences on the IDH3A protein, relevant for Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: This mutation (G271S) involved the substitution of Glycine with Serine at position 271, which was predicted to be damaging to the protein structure associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The Proline to Histidine change at position 304 (P304H) was found to disrupt the protein function, which was linked to Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The amino acid Isoleucine was altered to Threonine at position 327 (I327T), and its deleterious effects on protein function underscored its association with Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The missense variant rs200342067 in the FBN1 gene was identified with the largest effect size related to height, reducing height by 2.2 cm per copy of the minor allele and showing evidence of positive selection in the Peruvian population.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The SNP rs11070984 was associated with the cancer testis antigen (CTA) PRAME, which is relevant in the context of immunotherapy for SCLC. The identification of this SNP indicated its involvement in the mechanisms of chemoresistance, thereby highlighting its potential as a target for therapies aimed at enhancing treatment responses in SCLC.
title: Single Cell lineage Tracing Identifies Cancer Testis Antigens as Mediators of Chemoresistance in Small Cell Lung Cancer

finding: The intronic variant associated with blue eyes, <italic>rs12913832</italic>, was shown to be crucial in regulating the expression of the nearby <italic>OCA2</italic> gene, contributing significantly to the phenotype of blue eyes, especially when homozygous for the minor allele.
title: A general model for two-locus assortative mating analysis and prediction

finding: The SNP rs11547207 was found to co-localize as an aQTL for HDAC8 in Adrenal Gland, which coincided with a cis-eQTL within the 5'-UTR of the CIB2 gene, indicating potential overlapping regulatory mechanisms.
title: Identifying Genetic Regulatory Variants that Affect Transcription Factor Activity

finding: rs16976600 was tagged as a lead SNP by the L1 insertion in the NEDD4 gene associated with keloid, demonstrating a substantial linkage disequilibrium (R2 = 0.85) with a chromosomal risk locus.
title: Mobile elements in human population-specific genome and phenotype divergence

finding: rs8032158 was also established as a lead SNV linked to keloid severity in the Japanese population, and it was found to tag lead variants associated with keloid as well as Dupuytren's disease, indicating a potential shared etiology across these fibroblast inflammatory conditions.
title: Mobile elements in human population-specific genome and phenotype divergence

finding: This SNP was identified in high LD with L1-NEDD4, tagging lead variants that were associated with Dupuytren's disease and showing relevance in the context of diseases characterized by fibroblast inflammation.
title: Mobile elements in human population-specific genome and phenotype divergence

finding: The SNP rs11070926 was identified in a study focused on Wnt/β-Catenin signaling in liver cancers. Specifically, it was linked to increased hepatocyte interactions, particularly in the context of liver cancer patients. This finding suggested that the genetic variation represented by this SNP might play a role in the pathogenesis of liver cancer, highlighting its relevance as a potential biomarker.
title: Detection of reproducible liver cancer specific ligand-receptor signaling in blood

finding: The rs11633883 variant was shown to exist within a region that caused significantly increased luciferase expression for the derived haplotype compared to the ancestral haplotype, indicating potential regulatory relevance.
title: Three linked opposing regulatory variants under selection associate with IVD

finding: The rs66791338 variant, a 5-bp indel, demonstrated a reduction in luciferase expression when altered from the derived deletion to the ancestral insertion, indicating its impact on IVD expression and its importance as a regulatory variant.
title: Three linked opposing regulatory variants under selection associate with IVD

finding: The rs111540938 variant contributed to stronger signals of allelic skew in the MPRA assay, suggesting regulatory activity related to IVD expression.
title: Three linked opposing regulatory variants under selection associate with IVD

finding: The rs10851395 variant also exhibited strong allelic skew in the MPRA assay, influencing IVD expression based on its allele.
title: Three linked opposing regulatory variants under selection associate with IVD

finding: The SNP rs4924532 was associated with kidney function as indicated by eGFR GWAS results (p = 2.96 x 10^-40) and kidney tubule eQTL data (p = 6.45 x 10^-6), suggesting it plays a role in regulating INO80, a gene implicated in DNA damage repair related to kidney health.
title: Genetic Studies Highlight the Role of TET2 and INO80 in DNA Damage Response and Kidney Disease Pathogenesis

finding: The SNP rs8042729 showed a relationship to blood count and hypertension, serving as a proxy for rs140648465 in clusters associated with cortical tissue contrast.
title: Enhanced Brain Imaging Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The study identified alterations in the cis-regulatory mechanisms of ADAM10 in Alzheimer's disease (AD), with a particular focus on the SNP rs602602. This SNP was located near a fine-mapped lead SNP in strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs602602, suggesting it may disrupt a DNA-binding motif essential for transcription factor (TF) binding activity. Such disruptions were hypothesized to result in reduced TF binding activity in disease conditions compared to controls, highlighting its potential role in AD pathology.
title: Single-nucleus multi-omics identifies shared and distinct pathways in Pick’s and Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs121907970 resulted in a change of amino acid at position 247 from Arginine to Tryptophan, affecting the HEXA protein's 3D structure, relevant to Tay-Sachs disease.
title: Thirty two novel nsSNPs May effect on HEXA protein Leading to Tay-Sachs disease (TSD) Using a Computational Approach

finding: The SNP rs121907972 changed the amino acid at position 170 from Arginine to Tryptophan, impacting the structure of the HEXA protein and was significant in the context of Tay-Sachs disease.
title: Thirty two novel nsSNPs May effect on HEXA protein Leading to Tay-Sachs disease (TSD) Using a Computational Approach

finding: The SNP rs28941770 led to a change in the amino acid at position 178 from Arginine to Tryptophan, influencing the 3D structure of the HEXA protein and associated with Tay-Sachs disease.
title: Thirty two novel nsSNPs May effect on HEXA protein Leading to Tay-Sachs disease (TSD) Using a Computational Approach

finding: Functional characterization of the genetic risk variant rs12915901 at ALDH1A2 was shown to be significant within the context of osteoarthritis, identifying it as a critical target variant.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: This SNP was identified as a compound heterozygous loss-of-function mutation in the gene MESP2 in a patient-derived iPSC line related to spondylothoracic dysostosis (STD). Despite the loss-of-function mutations, the induction of presomitic mesoderm (PSM) was not affected, indicating that MESP2 loss did not hinder PSM development.
title: Modeling the Human Segmentation Clock with Pluripotent Stem Cells

finding: This SNP was also found as a compound heterozygous loss-of-function mutation in the MESP2 gene in the same patient-derived iPSC line associated with spondylothoracic dysostosis (STD). Like the other MESP2 mutation, it showed no impact on the successful induction of PSM, highlighting the resilience of the differentiation process despite these genetic alterations.
title: Modeling the Human Segmentation Clock with Pluripotent Stem Cells

finding: Identified as associated with participation in actigraphy, this locus had a partial linkage disequilibrium with variants linked to mental health questionnaire (MHQ) participation and FFQ participation. The allele associated with higher odds of multiple sclerosis correlated with lower odds of physical activity participation.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: This locus was linked to different participation traits, highlighting a shared genetic influence.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: The derived allele at rs1426654 in the SLC24A5 gene was reported with a frequency of 1, indicating its close association with skin depigmentation in Europeans. This finding was significant as it reflected the pigmentation traits of the individuals from the Mokrin sample.
title: Kinship, acquired and inherited status, and population structure at the Early Bronze Age Mokrin necropolis in northern Serbia

finding: The estimated frequency of the derived G allele at rs12913832 in the HERC2 gene was 0.4498, which correlated with iris depigmentation. This frequency was comparable to that of modern day populations in Tuscany, providing evidence of similar genetic traits in ancient and contemporary populations.
title: Kinship, acquired and inherited status, and population structure at the Early Bronze Age Mokrin necropolis in northern Serbia

finding: The intergenic SNP rs35346340 exhibited linkage disequilibrium with various heart disease-associated SNPs, like rs2521501 (CAD) and rs4932373 (MI). It displayed strong interactions with FURIN and was found to be a significant eQTL in tissues relevant to cardiovascular health.
title: Dissecting Regulatory Non-Coding Heart Disease GWAS Loci with High-Resolution 3D Chromatin Interactions Reveals Causal Genes with Pathophysiological Relevance to Heart Failure

finding: Rs2620381 in miR-627 was found to be significantly associated with RA with a P-value of 2.55×10-3. The association was confirmed after adjusting for known HLA alleles, indicating its potential importance in RA susceptibility.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: This nonsynonymous SNP in the SNX1 gene showed notable association with NAc regions' reactivity, particularly in a patient-only subsample, suggesting its involvement in neuropsychiatric conditions.
title: Gene Set-Based Analysis of the Endosomal Sorting Processes Cargo Selection and Membrane Tubulation with Human Reward System Reactivity

finding: The SNP rs16969968 in the CHRNA3 gene was associated with cognition, suggesting it may mediate the risk for developing Nicotine Dependence. This finding highlighted a potential genetic predisposition affecting neurological outcomes and behaviors within the Zoroastrian-Parsi community.
title: Ancient Migrations - The first complete genome assembly, annotation and variants of the Zoroastrian-Parsi community of India

finding: The rs1051730 allele in the CHRNA5 gene was identified as linked to cognition and was also implicated in the risk for developing Nicotine Dependence. This SNP contributed to understanding of addiction pathways relevant to this community.
title: Ancient Migrations - The first complete genome assembly, annotation and variants of the Zoroastrian-Parsi community of India

finding: The intronic variant rs762551 in the CYP1A2 gene was associated with leflunomide induced toxicity in Rheumatoid Arthritis treatment. This finding underscored the importance of pharmacogenomic insights in predicting treatment outcomes for Zoroastrian-Parsi individuals.
title: Ancient Migrations - The first complete genome assembly, annotation and variants of the Zoroastrian-Parsi community of India

finding: This SNP was part of Hirisplex-S and showed a high correlation with skin and iris pigmentation in individuals of south Asian ancestry.
title: How to choose sets of ancestry informative markers: A supervised feature selection approach

finding: The SNP rs1496904 was identified with near genome-wide significance (POIROT p = 9.58 × 10^-8) in a study analyzing quantitative anthropometric measures at birth in infants. This SNP is located 138kb from the transcription start site of the gene SEMA6D, which has been previously linked to traits such as arm fat mass, leg fat mass, body fat percentage, and height.
title: POIROT: A powerful test for parent-of-origin effects in unrelated samples leveraging multiple phenotypes

finding: The SNX1*D465N variant locus was associated with Alzheimer's disease, demonstrating the relevance of SNX1 in retromer function which is pertinent to late-onset Alzheimer's.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs4702, specifically the G allele, was identified as associated with schizophrenia. The study reported that the presence of this allele led to downregulation of FURIN expression by the microRNA miR-338-3p, which subsequently reduced the production of Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor (BDNF). This finding described a mechanism by which the rs4702 G allele may contribute to the pathophysiology of schizophrenia, linking genetic variation to gene expression and subsequent phenotypic outcomes related to mental health.
title: Large eQTL meta-analysis reveals differing patterns between cerebral cortical and cerebellar brain regions

finding: The variant rs56077333 located at the CHRNA5-A3-B4 locus showed significant genotype-by-environment interaction effects with smoking on lung function (FFR ratio, i.e., FEV1/FVC), with a vQTL p-value of 1.1×10^-14 and a GEI p-value of 4.6×10^-25, indicating its role in lung function dependent on smoking status.
title: Genotype-by-environment interactions inferred from genetic effects on phenotypic variability in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs62015197 at the IDH2 locus was associated with serum urate levels in response to allopurinol treatment for gout, indicating its influence in uric acid metabolism.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control
